message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with distributed computing and fault tolerance, which are central topics in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also involves cryptographic techniques, which are relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The use of verifiable secret sharing and the analysis of efficiency suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper's focus on communication complexity and information theory suggests that it may also be relevant to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Finally, the paper's use of probabilistic analysis and machine learning techniques suggests that it may also be relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
